Detailed Description

A waypoint represents an event in the metadata stream.

It encapsulates a category, an attribute, a timestamp and a duration.

To create an instance of a Waypoint, use the Facade::createWaypoint() function.

See Also
Attribute class

Member Function Documentation

Attribute* Chronicle::Waypoint::addAttribute ( const String &  name,
const Variant &  value = Variant() 
)

Adds an attribute to the waypoint.

Warning
The waypoint has ownership of the attribute; do not destroy the attribute after this method returns, and do not attempt to access the attribute once ownership of the waypoint has been passed to the Facade or after the waypoint itself has been destroyed.
Parameters
nameThe name of the attribute.
valueThe value of the attribute.
Returns
A pointer to the newly-created attribute.
void Chronicle::Waypoint::addAttribute ( Attribute *  attribute)

Adds an attribute to the waypoint.

Warning
The waypoint takes ownership of the attribute; do not destroy the attribute after this method returns, and do not attempt to access the attribute once ownership of the waypoint has been passed to the Facade or after the waypoint itself has been destroyed.

Adding an attribute that is already in the waypoint has no effect.

Parameters
attributeA pointer to an attribute.
Attribute* Chronicle::Waypoint::addSubattribute ( const String &  parentName,
const String &  name,
const Variant &  value = Variant() 
)

Adds a subattribute to a parent attribute in the waypoint.

Note
If there is no attribute with the name parentName then it will be automatically added to the waypoint.
Warning
The waypoint has ownership of the subattribute; do not destroy the subattribute after this method returns, and do not attempt to access the subattribute once ownership of the waypoint has been passed to the Facade or after the waypoint itself has been destroyed.
Parameters
parentNameThe name of the parent attribute.
nameThe name of the subattribute.
valueThe value of the subattribute.
Returns
A pointer to the newly-created subattribute.
AttributeList* Chronicle::Waypoint::attributes ( ) const
inline

Returns the collection of attributes for this waypoint.

Warning
The return value is NULL if there are no attributes.
Do not attempt to use the collection after once the waypoint has been passed to the Facade, or after the waypoint itself has been destroyed.
Returns
A pointer to the attribute list, or NULL if no attributes have been added to the waypoint.
See Also
addAttribute(const String &name, const String &value), addAttribute(Attribute *attribute), hasAttributes()
const String& Chronicle::Waypoint::category ( ) const
inline

Returns the waypoint category.

See Also
Facade::createWaypoint(), setCategory()
Waypoint* Chronicle::Waypoint::clone ( ) const

Returns a copy of the waypoint.

All attributes are also copied.

See Also
AttributeList::clone()
void Chronicle::Waypoint::destroy ( )

Destroys the waypoint.

Warning
Do not destroy a waypoint that has been passed to the Facade::waypointReached() member function.
Duration Chronicle::Waypoint::duration ( ) const
inline

Returns the waypoint duration.

See Also
setDuration()
bool Chronicle::Waypoint::hasAttributes ( ) const

Returns true if the waypoint has attributes, otherwise false.

See Also
addAttribute(const String &name, const String &value), addAttribute(Attribute *attribute), attributes()
void Chronicle::Waypoint::setCategory ( const String &  category)

Sets the waypoint category.

The category is initially set when the waypoint is constructed, but the category can be changed afterwards.

Parameters
categoryThe waypoint category.
See Also
category()
void Chronicle::Waypoint::setDuration ( Duration  duration)

Sets the waypoint duration.

The default duration is zero (0).

Parameters
durationThe waypoint duration.
See Also
duration()
void Chronicle::Waypoint::setTime ( Time  time)

Sets the waypoint time.

The time is automatically set by the waypoint is constructed, but the time can be changed afterwards.

Parameters
timeThe waypoint time.
See Also
time()
Time Chronicle::Waypoint::time ( ) const
inline

Returns the waypoint time.

The time is automatically set when the waypoint is constructed.

See Also
Facade::createWaypoint(), setTime()
